settings.description: Show a pop-up notification to the end user when the Falcon sensor blocks, kills, or quarantines. These messages also show up in the Windows Event Viewer under Applications and Service Logs.
settings.name: Notify End Users

settings.description: Upload all unknown detection-related executables for advanced analysis in the cloud.
settings.name: Unknown Detection-Related Executables

settings.description: Upload all unknown executables for advanced analysis in the cloud.
settings.name: Unknown Executables

settings.description: Blocks attempts to tamper with the sensor. If disabled, the sensor still creates detections for tampering attempts but doesn’t block them. Disabling not recommended.
settings.name: Sensor Tampering Protection

settings.description: Allows the sensor to get more data from a user-mode component it loads into all eligible processes, which augments online machine learning and turns on additional detections. Recommend testing with critical applications before full deployment.
settings.name: Additional User Mode Data

settings.description: Provides visibility into malicious PowerShell interpreter usage. For hosts running Windows 10, Script-Based Execution Monitoring may be used instead.
settings.name: Interpreter-Only

settings.description: Provides visibility into malicious System Management Automation engine usage by any application. Requires Interpreter-Only.
settings.name: Engine (Full Visibility)

settings.description: For hosts running Windows 10 and Servers 2016 and later, provides visibility into suspicious scripts and VBA macros in Office documents. Requires Quarantine & Security Center Registration toggle to be enabled.
settings.name: Script-Based Execution Monitoring

settings.description: Allows the sensor to monitor unencrypted HTTP traffic and certain encrypted HTTPS traffic on the sensor for malicious patterns and generate detection events on non-Server systems.
settings.name: HTTP Detections

settings.description: Remove certain information from HTTP Detection events, including URL, raw HTTP header and POST bodies if they were present. This does not affect the generation of HTTP Detections, only additional details that would be included and may include personal information (depending on the malware in question). When disabled, the information is used to improve the response to detection events. Has no effect unless HTTP Detections is also enabled.
settings.name: Redact HTTP Detection Details

settings.description: Provides additional visibility into application exploits by using CPU hardware features that detect suspicious control flows. Available only for hosts running Windows 10 (RS4) or Windows Server 2016 Version 1803 or later and Skylake or later CPU.
settings.name: Hardware-Enhanced Exploit Detection

settings.description: Provides visibility into in-memory attacks by scanning for suspicious artifacts on hosts with the following: an integrated GPU and supporting OS libraries, Windows 10 v1607 (RS1) or later, and a Skylake or newer Intel CPU.
settings.name: Memory Scanning

settings.description: Allows memory scanning to use the CPU or virtual CPU when an integrated GPU is not available. All Intel processors supported, requires Windows 8.1/2012 R2 or later.
settings.name: Scan with CPU

settings.description: Provides visibility into BIOS. Detects suspicious and unexpected images. Recommend testing to monitor system startup performance before full deployment.
settings.name: BIOS Deep Visibility

settings.description: Use cloud-based machine learning informed by global analysis of executables to detect and prevent known malware for your online hosts.
settings.name: Cloud Anti-malware

settings.description: Use cloud-based machine learning informed by global analysis of executables to detect and prevent adware and potentially unwanted programs (PUP) for your online hosts.
settings.name: Adware & PUP

settings.description: For offline and online hosts, use sensor-based machine learning to identify and analyze unknown executables as they run to detect and prevent malware.
settings.name: Sensor Anti-malware

settings.description: For offline and online hosts running on-demand scans initiated by end users, use sensor-based machine learning to identify and analyze unknown executables to detect and prevent malware.
settings.name: Sensor Anti-malware for End-User Initiated Scans

settings.description: For online hosts running on-demand scans initiated by end users, use cloud-based machine learning informed by global analysis of executables to detect and prevent known malware.
settings.name: Cloud Anti-malware for End-User Initiated Scans

settings.description: Start an on-demand scan when an end user inserts a USB device. To adjust detection sensitivity, change Anti-malware Detection levels in On-Demand Scans Machine Learning.
settings.name: USB Insertion Triggered Scan

settings.description: Use machine learning to analyze suspicious files when they're written to disk. To adjust detection sensitivity, change Anti-malware Detection levels in Sensor Machine Learning and Cloud Machine Learning.
settings.name: Detect on Write

settings.description: Use machine learning to quarantine suspicious files when they're written to disk. To adjust quarantine sensitivity, change Anti-malware Prevention levels in Sensor Machine Learning and Cloud Machine Learning.
settings.name: Quarantine on Write

settings.description: Quarantine executable files after they’re prevented by NGAV. When this is enabled, we recommend setting anti-malware prevention levels to Moderate and not using other antivirus solutions. CrowdStrike Falcon registers with Windows Security Center, disabling Windows Defender.
settings.name: Quarantine & Security Center Registration

settings.description: Quarantine executable files after they’re prevented by NGAV.
settings.name: Quarantine on Removable Media

settings.description: Block processes matching hashes that you add to IOC Management with the action set to "Block" or "Block, hide detection".
settings.name: Custom Blocking

settings.description: Block processes that CrowdStrike analysts classify as suspicious. These are focused on dynamic IOAs, such as malware, exploits and other threats.
settings.name: Suspicious Processes

settings.description: Block registry operations that CrowdStrike analysts classify as suspicious. Focuses on dynamic IOAs, such as ASEPs and security config changes. The associated process may be killed.
settings.name: Suspicious Registry Operations

settings.description: Block execution of scripts and commands that CrowdStrike analysts classify as suspicious. Requires Interpreter-Only and/or Script-Based Execution Monitoring.
settings.name: Suspicious Scripts and Commands

settings.description: Block processes that CrowdStrike Intelligence analysts classify as malicious. These are focused on static hash-based IOCs.
settings.name: Intelligence-Sourced Threats

settings.description: Block the loading of kernel drivers that CrowdStrike analysts have identified as suspicious. Available on Windows 10 and Windows Server 2016 and later.
settings.name: Suspicious Kernel Drivers

settings.description: An Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) bypass attempt was detected and blocked. This may have been part of an attempted exploit.
settings.name: Force ASLR

settings.description: A process that had Force Data Execution Prevention (Force DEP) applied tried to execute non-executable memory and was blocked.
settings.name: Force DEP

settings.description: A heap spray attempt was detected and blocked. This may have been part of an attempted exploit.
settings.name: Heap Spray Preallocation

settings.description: Allocating memory to the NULL (0) memory page was detected and blocked. This may have been part of an attempted exploit.
settings.name: NULL Page Allocation

settings.description: Overwriting a Structured Exception Handler (SEH) was detected and may have been blocked. This may have been part of an attempted exploit.
settings.name: SEH Overwrite Protection

settings.description: Deletion of backups often indicative of ransomware activity.
settings.name: Backup Deletion

settings.description: A process associated with Cryptowall was blocked.
settings.name: Cryptowall

settings.description: A process that created a file with a known ransomware extension was terminated.
settings.name: File Encryption

settings.description: A process determined to be associated with Locky was blocked.
settings.name: Locky

settings.description: A process associated with a high volume of file system operations typical of ransomware behavior was terminated.
settings.name: File System Access

settings.description: Create an alert when a suspicious process deletes volume shadow copies. Recommended: Use audit mode with a test group to try allowlisting trusted software before turning on Protect.
settings.name: Volume Shadow Copy - Audit

settings.description: Prevent suspicious processes from deleting volume shadow copies.
settings.name: Volume Shadow Copy - Protect

settings.description: Creation of a process, such as a command prompt, from an exploited browser or browser flash plugin was blocked.
settings.name: Application Exploitation Activity

settings.description: Execution of a command shell was blocked and is indicative of the system hosting a Chopper web page.
settings.name: Chopper Webshell

settings.description: A suspicious file written by a browser attempted to execute and was blocked.
settings.name: Drive-by Download

settings.description: Kill processes that unexpectedly injected code into another process.
settings.name: Code Injection

settings.description: JavaScript executing from a command line via rundll32.exe was prevented.
settings.name: JavaScript Execution Via Rundll32

settings.description: A command line process associated with Windows logon bypass was prevented from executing.
settings.name: Windows Logon Bypass ("Sticky Keys")

settings.description: Kill suspicious processes determined to be stealing logins and passwords.
settings.name: Credential Dumping

settings.description: Perform advanced remediation for IOA detections to kill processes, quarantine files, remove scheduled tasks, and clear and delete ASEP registry values.
settings.name: Advanced Remediation
